* Creates a Deadline representing the task the user
* wishes to store. If the deadline is entered in a
* recognisable format, then the deadline is stored
* as a date and time rather than simply a String.
* @param name Name of task to be completed.
* Formats the Deadline task for display to the user.
* @return The output string to be displayed.
* Formats the Deadline task as it is to be stored/saved
* @return The string the task is to be saved as.
* Initialises the Duke program on startup
* by loading the previously saved task list
* onto the working list, if there exists one.
* Otherwise, the working list starts empty.
* @param filePath Relative file path to the file the task list was previously saved in.
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {

* Creates an Event Task representing the event the user
* wishes to store. If the event date/time is entered in a
* recognisable format, then the event date/time is stored
* as a date and time rather than simply a String.
* @param input Date and time of event.
* Formats the Event task for display to the user.
* @return The output string to be displayed.

* @return The string the task is to be saved as.
* Parses the user input and processes the commands accordingly.

* @return false if user input is "bye", and true otherwise.

* Prints the message for whenever the user adds a task.
* The message tells the user that the task has been added
* and displays the task just added.
* @param list Working task list, for printing reference.
private void printAdded(Task task, TaskList list) {
System.out.println("    Got it. I've added this task:");

* Prints a message to notify user of an invalid command.

* Loads a previously saved task list from the hard disk
* @param list Working task list of the program, for loading the saved data onto.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the file specified by the filepath cannot be found.
public void load(TaskList list) throws FileNotFoundException {
* Saves any changes to the task list to the hard disk
* immediately by overwriting the original file.
* @param list Updated working task list of the program, for rewriting the file with.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs in writing the file.
public void save(TaskList list) throws IOException {
* Outputs a tick or cross symbol to indicate whether
